text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Kuwait's press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Kuwait welcomes diplomatic representation agreement between Qatar and Bahrain.
- Commerce and Industry Minister Jassem al-Mudaf says ministry is studying a measure on allowing foreign investors to trade in Kuwaiti shares.

- Kuwait mulls new foreign corporate tax law, commerce and industry minister says. Kuwait has said it was planning a new regulation that would reduce to a maximum of about 30 percent tax on the profit of foreign firms operating in Kuwait from 55 percent.
- Parliament to discuss unemployment among Kuwaitis on Tuesday.
- Communications Minister Jassem al-Oun says new telecommunications company could be established in 1997.
- Gulf Cooperation Council -- Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, Bahrain, Oman, the United Arab Emirates and Qatar -- moves to reduce dependence on expatriate workers, Kuwaiti official says.
